On 19/12/2007, Derek James <djames@...> wrote:
>
> On Dec 19, 2007 1:30 PM, Colin Green <locster01@...> wrote:
> > Also, GUI development in Java is a horrendous
> > ordeal
> > > compared to VS and the resulting front end has a tendency to look like an
> > OS/2
> > > program.
>
> Eh, it's not the most beautiful front-end in the world, but you can do
> some pretty slick-looking stuff. I'm currently implementing my
> cortical modeling algorithm in Java, and the resulting networks are
> 3D, so I'm using Java3D for visualization of the networks, and I'm
> quite happy with it. When it's in better shape I'll post some screen
> shots.

I just want to clarify that that isn't my comment above, although I
know what Wesley means - the 'standard' GUI 'widgets' in Java have a
tendency to look a bit unpolished shall we say. I know Eclipse uses
the SWT library that is a standard API that patches through to native
GUI widgets - improving the look and performance of standard GUIs.  3D
toolkits are a different ballgame though.

Yes please do post screenshots if you get the chance - sounds interesting.

Colin
